description: A Gear Second-enhanced version of Luffy's signature Gomu Gomu no Pistol technique. By combining his rubber body's elasticity with the dramatically increased speed and power of Gear Second, Luffy delivers a devastating punch that can blast opponents backward with tremendous force.
limitations: Requires Gear Second to be active, which puts strain on Luffy's body and has a time limit.
evolutionNotes: This technique represents Luffy's evolution from basic rubber attacks to speed-enhanced combat, developed specifically to match CP9's Rokushiki techniques.

description: A Gear Second-enhanced concentrated strike where Luffy stretches his arm back and launches a powerful punch aimed at the opponent's torso. The increased velocity from Gear Second makes this attack devastating enough to hurt even the toughest opponents.
limitations: Requires Gear Second to be active, which puts strain on Luffy's body. The concentrated nature of the attack also requires precise targeting.
evolutionNotes: Part of Luffy's growing arsenal of Gear Second techniques, showcasing his ability to adapt his existing moves to the enhanced form.

description: One of Luffy's most iconic power-ups, Gear Second accelerates his blood flow by using his rubber body as a pump, dramatically increasing his speed, power, and metabolism. Steam rises from his body as a visual indicator of the technique's activation. In this episode, Luffy uses it for the second time against Rob Lucci.
limitations: Puts significant strain on Luffy's body and cardiovascular system. Early uses had strict time limits and left Luffy exhausted afterward.
evolutionNotes: Luffy developed this technique after observing CP9's Soru (Shave) technique, demonstrating his combat genius and adaptability. This is the second activation against Lucci in their battle.
